### PR summary [c2328712c3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18864/commits/c2328712c31ab8504fa65fa0db0db5d47100a1b9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`- coe_to_nonUnitalAlgHom`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11791383641/job/32843313107)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11791383641/job/32843313369)
Wow I am late to the party :)

LGTM otherwise, thanks!

bors d+

LGTM otherwise, thanks!

bors d+
Could you indicate where this lemma is needed (so maybe we can fix that later on)?
I don't think that's useful to do at this point. Every remaining `nolint simpNF` deserves this request, no?

It looks like we're now missing any lemmas describing the forward direction of the isomorphism `biprodIsoProd`. Can these be restored? 

Obviously we'd prefer these lemmas to be auto-generated in some way, and if `simps` can't do this correctly then let's also have an issue tracking that.
They are not used in Mathlib, so I propose that anyone wanting them adds them when/if they are needed.
What's the justification of removing the porting note and `simp` attribute here?
Ah, I presume it's similar to the `FreeSemigroup` version below!
Can we make this one (and the below) `simp` now?

Could I request that this is out of scope for this PR?

If someone wants this to be `@[simp]`, they can do that, but we can't get bogged down in investigating adding `@[simp]` to anything we touch the comments for.

I'm not quite sure I follow the reasoning here. To my understanding, a comment like this is to track the tech debt that `simp` was removed. And so removing the comment and not restoring the attribute means we are keeping the tech debt, but removing the fact that it can be tracked. To me, losing the fact that these lemmas used to be `simp` (and thus that the `simp` set is now weaker) doesn't seem beneficial to mathlib. Could you clarify?

```suggestion
-- This is not a simp lemma because the left-hand side is not in simp normal form.
@[to_additive]
```

Surely we should set the priority *higher*?
```suggestion
-- We set the simp priority slightly higher than default; so that the later more general lemmas don't replace it.
@[simp 1100] protected lemma nsmul_eq_mul (m n : ℕ) : m • n = m * n := rfl
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: cleanup of simpNF
